Has anyone tried to put colors from the theme settings onto a custom Section?
It works setting the color initially when choosing the custom section from the UI, but if I go into the theme settings and change the color of that "light_bg_1" it will not get applied to the already placed custom section.. Unlike the modules that utilize the setting; they get the new color.

Is it so that when inserting a custom Section onto a page it will 'lock in' those settings until its end of life - even though the color is applied with the "dynamic approach" like shown in the image?
I think this is more like setting a default value in a module field. Once the page is live changing the default in the module editor doesnâ€™t change the live pages

What's strange is that you would at least expect to get the new color if you inserted a new custom section after changing the theme-color, but it remains the same color :thinking_face:
Here I have changed the theme-color to to the red'ish color, applied, saved, published and created a new custom section and it is still turning up orange (previous theme color) :sweat_smile:
Ah yes I would have expected that to happen too
You'd expect it to be red if colors were set on "insertion"
I created a new page, and it remains orange
that seems very odd, maybe something for someone at HubSpot to answer
I changed it from the "background_color=" property to "class=" and it now *works* :+1: In e.g. theme-override.css the class can fetch the theme setting
Ah yeah good idea that makes sense
